item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, January 31, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI O3-Mini (314 points | 319 comments)
2. Bypass DeepSeek censorship by speaking in hex (104 points | 66 comments)
3. Elite on the 6502: The original 6502 assembly source, heavily commented (29 points | 1 comment)
4. FBI, Dutch police disrupt 'Manipulaters' phishing gang (63 points | 9 comments)
5. Show HN: Uscope, a new Linux debugger written from scratch (137 points | 56 comments)
6. FurtherAI (YC W24) Is Hiring engineers and researchers to build Vertical AI agents ( | hide)
7. Theoretical limitations of multi-layer Transformer (54 points | 3 comments)
8. Paris P2P Festival and Hackathon (15 points | 1 comment)
9. GenAI Art Is the Least Imaginative Use of AI Imaginable (7 points | discuss)
10. Zusie – My Relay Computer (77 points | 20 comments)
11. The Tensor Cookbook (30 points | 1 comment)
12. Fixing E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial for the Atari 2600 (2013) (73 points | 25 comments)
13. US government agency argues that money isn't property–so it can take yours (37 points | discuss)
14. Shell-ish scripting in Go with ease (69 points | 11 comments)
15. Better Know a Ruby Thing: Singleton Classes (47 points | 4 comments)
16. Large Language Models Think Too Fast to Explore Effectively (42 points | 5 comments)
17. Living with Nausea: My Story in Six Charts (75 points | 30 comments)
18. Apple files emergency motion to become defendant in US vs. Google [pdf] (300 points | 300 comments)
19. Images reveal exocomets around nearby stars (72 points | 4 comments)
20. Meta in talks to reincorporate in Texas or another state, WSJ reports (95 points | 79 comments)
21. Real-time, river sections downstream of sewage discharges from storm overflows (36 points | 11 comments)
22. MillenniumDB: Property graph and RDF engine, still in development (55 points | 22 comments)
23. Instagram and Facebook Blocked and Hid Abortion Pill Providers' Posts (73 points | 35 comments)
24. Federal employees told to remove pronouns from email signatures by end of day (17 points | 11 comments)
25. Hydro: Distributed Programming Framework for Rust (241 points | 42 comments)
26. Show HN: voidDB – A transactional key-value DB written in Go for 64-bit Linux (47 points | 13 comments)
27. Taking a $15 Casio F91W 5km underwater (291 points | 71 comments)
28. How to Train an AI Image Model on Yourself (133 points | 30 comments)
29. Show HN: Ldump – serialize any Lua data (87 points | 38 comments)
30. Hacker News for Gamedev (429 points | 188 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, January 31, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
